solution_line_template: The items he returned were valued at ${tv_cost} + ${returned_bike_cost} = $<<{tv_cost}+{returned_bike_cost}={returned_items_value}>>{returned_items_value}
So far he is out {total_purchase}-{returned_items_value} = <<{total_purchase}-{returned_items_value}={out_after_returns}>>{out_after_returns} after recouping {returned_items_value}.
An item that is {percent_more}% more expensive cost 1 + {percent_more} = {multiplier} times as much as the item
So that means the bike he sold cost ${returned_bike_cost} * {multiplier} = $<<{returned_bike_cost}*{multiplier}={sold_bike_cost}>>{sold_bike_cost}
From the bike that he had bought for {sold_bike_cost}, he was out {sold_bike_cost}-{sold_bike_sale_price} =<<{sold_bike_cost}-{sold_bike_sale_price}={out_on_sold_bike}>>{out_on_sold_bike}
If he also bought a toaster worth {toaster_cost}, he was out {out_after_bike_sale}+{toaster_cost} = <<{out_after_bike_sale}+{toaster_cost}={answer}>>{answer}
